meanings.definition: Prefabricated: manufactured in advance and ready for quick assembly
meanings.sent1: The prefab house was built in a factory and then put together on-site.
meanings.sent2: The prefab furniture was easy to assemble with just a few screws.
meanings.sent3: The prefab cake mix made baking a breeze for the busy mom.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit looked like a prefab costume straight out of a catalog.
meanings.sent5: The prefab playground equipment made the park a popular spot for families.

meanings.definition: Prefab: a prefabricated building or structure
meanings.sent1: We ordered a prefab shed for our backyard storage needs.
meanings.sent2: The company specializes in manufacturing prefabs for disaster relief.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended the cardboard box was a prefab castle.
meanings.sent4: The prefab stood out among the traditional buildings in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The prefab was delivered in sections and assembled on-site in just a few days.

meanings.definition: Prefab: to manufacture or construct in advance for quick assembly
meanings.sent1: The company will prefab the components before shipping them to the construction site.
meanings.sent2: They prefabbed the walls off-site to save time during the building process.
meanings.sent3: He tried to prefab his excuses for being late to work.
meanings.sent4: The team decided to prefab the entire structure to meet the tight deadline.
meanings.sent5: She carefully prefabbed each section to ensure a smooth assembly process.
